I've been playing LoL since its release before OCE servers even existed, i even still have the boxed edition of the game.

I love the fact that this is a purely skill oriented game, **not** pay to win.

After a while the game felt like it was getting a little stale. Even though you could get somewhere through your own hard work / effort, it felt like the game was biased in favor of people who could afford to pay money.

Not only because they could get cool skins, but because they could afford to get champions runes faster via IP boosts, learn things quicker and have an advantage.

I was delighted when both the rune system and the whole currency system was revamped and not only that, the crafting system was introduced.

This completely leveled the playing field in terms of being able to bring out champions full abilities because you didn't need to buy a specific rune set to do that anymore.

Furthermore with the crafting system it gave even non-paying users a chance to own awesome skins.

I fell in love with Riot and this game all over again.

Time passed, i had to take a year off. I come back a couple of weeks ago and what do i find?

The prestige content.

OK... how do i get prestige points? You **must** pay for them.

Excuse me? Furthermore (i've learned from others in the forum) you don't get keep the points you've earned from previous events...

What happened Riot? Your ethos this entire time has been providing UX first, now you've done a complete 180 and are now discriminating implementing a class system (i.e. those with prestige and those without)?

If you need a steady stream of financing, stick 1 or 2 ad banners in the game loading screen. As long as they don't eat up too much bandwidth we won't care because they're visible for what? 30 - 60 seconds?

As someone who has been playing since beta, and is a game developer. [snip] having a game were ONLY cosmetic content is purchased BUT ALSO is mostly freely avaliable is amazing and you're taking advantage of that fact.

If you dont want to spend money, just play the game without the only 6 skins that are purchased only. Your arrogance is overwhelming..

Honestly, this just makes me sad. I have played from season 3 and spent countless hours and money buying skins and grinding for them. The whole skin system is just getting ridiculous now. How much money are we expected to pay for skins like these? Having like one a year would be great but I certainly will not be sitting in ARAM again for 4 weeks per event just to grind for tokens for a skin that I really really want. The prestige skins are no longer unique because Riot just releases one after the other because people like different champions so they get more sales of loot bundles. Well I've had enough. Not going to bother buying anymore skins or grinding for them. I have spent enough money on this game and although its been great, I'm done with trying to collect certain skin themes etc its just near impossible. How can anyone have the time or money to get like 600 prestige points in one year to try and get all of these nice skins. NO skin is worth that much I don't care how nice it looks.Riot, come back because you're too far out the gate.
Im a little confused so if within the next week i reroll a prestige skin i get the border but next year if i reroll i wont. So if i reroll the thresh prestige skin i get a border?

If you reroll any prestige skin released before 2020 you will receive the border with it. It sounds like this will persist for those skins. If you reroll any Prestige skin released 2020 or later, you will *not* receive the border.

So if you manage to reroll shards into the Pulsefire Thresh Prestige you will get the border with it. You should still get the border even if you don't manage to reroll it within the next month.

So the issue with complaining to Riot is that;

1. OCE is a tiny community and represents a very small percentage of the player base.
2. Riot is owned by Tencent now, a Chinese conglomerate who care about nothing but their profit line.

I would like to think that Riot still cares about their game and community and these money grab decisions are not their own. Ultimately the only way you'll see things change is if Tencent aren't making the money they want to. So the best way to make changes would be to not put any money into league of legends or any Riot (Tencent) products.

Also, to Riot, it sucks you guys sold out, and if anyone at the studio does have a say in these decisions maybe you can stop greedy decisions like these from killing your game after players start boycotting it.
